intro: Polyosma brachyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved polyosma, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers, which are often visited by native bees and birds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
